highlights: Principle architect on successful $3M digital transformation from legacy on premise infrastructure to cloud solutions hosted in Azure
Continually perform TCO and ROI assessments for all production resources, resulting in monthly hosting costs being 10-15% below budget
Implemented monitoring framework leveraging tools such as Telegraf and Grafana to proactively identify and resolve performance bottlenecks, reducing customer slowdowns by 90%
Reduced incident response time from hours to minutes through development of custom alerting API delivering near real-time notifications at the team level
Defined new Infrastructure as Code (IaC) deployment process replacing 100% of manual infrastructure provisioning with version controlled Terraform scripts
Created and maintained Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) environment driving application of critical updates from 10 to 90%
Worked closed with Security Team to ensure 100% Information Technology compliance in SOC Type II Audit
Replaced aging virtual hosts with state-of-the-art Storage Spaces Direct (S2D) cluster, doubling critical server availability and resilience
Introduced Dell's out-of-band infrastructure (iDRAC) into production environment reducing downtime by 80%
Implemented and championed remote administration tools and techniques decreasing incident response times and reducing production server logins
Improved existing System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM) environment maintaining 100% workstation compliance
Secured IT infrastructure by implementing BitLocker and Shielded VMs
Planned and executed the upgrade from Lync Server 2013 to Skype for Business 2015
Acted as primary contact for all issues in corporate datacenter co-location
Developed key performance indicators (KPIs) for internal services to increase overall internal IT performance and accountability
Designed and implemented new user-friendly ticketing system decreasing of technician response time and increasing end-user satisfaction from 70% to 95%
Maintained IT knowledge-base increasing productivity for IT staff
Bolstered workstation security by implementing Microsoft LAPS, preventing the use of shared admin passwords
Promoted to Lead Systems Administrator in less than six months of employment
Created and implemented a procedure to securely remove and dispose of hard drives containing HIPPA protected data
Lead server refresh project for the University of Florida Nuclear Training Reactor completing the project 4 weeks before deadline and $25K below budget
Performed workstation update project with the University of Florida Department of Microbiology increasing work efficiency by 150%
Over the course of 5 years delivered over $300K of end-of-life assets to community non-profits
